intro: Chelyella, commonly known as the "saddleback fern," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its unique, palmately compound leaves that often have a distinct, saddle-shaped appearance. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Chelyella species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage. They produce small, inconspicuous flowers followed by berries that are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
